subject: AI & Agents
title: ELIZA: The First Chatbot
description: A 60-second lesson on ELIZA: The First Chatbot.

hook.text: In 1966, people poured out their feelings to a computer program. They knew it wasn't real. They didn't care.

buildup.text: Joseph Weizenbaum built ELIZA at MIT. It mimicked a therapist using simple pattern matching.

discovery.text: ELIZA matched keywords and rephrased your input as questions. 'I'm sad' became 'Why are you sad?'

twist.text: Weizenbaum was horrified that people formed emotional bonds with something so simple.

climax.text: He wrote a book warning that humans anthropomorphize machines too easily.

punchline.text: The first chatbot taught us more about humans than machines.

quiz.question: What technique did ELIZA use to simulate conversation?
options: Simple pattern matching and keyword rephrasing
